screen.title: Viewing a blueprint
screen.summary: Blueprints help communities to discuss their ideas and then track their implementation
screen.callout: Blueprints track who is involved in a feature idea, how well defined the idea is and any implementation progress.
Each blueprint has a summary, with a link to the full detail of the specification.
Launchpad can link blueprints to meetings and development sprints and generate an agenda from them.
The dependency tree offers a visual overview of where the blueprint fits into the project's development plan.

screen.title: Planning meetings
screen.summary: Launchpad can track the real world meetings that communities have, using blueprints to form an agenda
screen.callout: Everyone involved in the meeting can propose blueprints for discussion.
All the practical information about a meeting or sprint is just a click away. People planning to attend can register using their Launchpad account.

screen.title: Browsing blueprints
screen.summary: An overview of a community's blueprints
screen.callout: Communities set the priority of the blueprints they're working on.
The i shows that this is blueprint is documentation, rather than a plan for a new feature.
Launchpad tracks both how well-defined an idea is and the progress of its implementation.
Communities can tie blueprints to specific releases of their software.

screen.title: Creating a road map
screen.summary: Launchpad automatically develops a road map based on the priorities and dependencies of individual blueprints
